channel.title: Arctic Data Center on NCEAS Training Materials Catalog
channel.description: Recent content in Arctic Data Center on NCEAS Training Materials Catalog

item.title: Arctic Data Center Training (October 2020)
item.description: Dates: October 19 - October 23, 2020 Location: Online Venue: NCEAS, 735 State St., Suite 300, UC Santa Barbara The Arctic Data Center provides training in data science and data management, as these are critical skills for the stewardship of the data, software, and other research products that are preserved in the Arctic Data Center. A goal of the Arctic Data Center is to advance data archiving and promote reproducible science and data reuse.

item.title: Dataset Publishing with the Arctic Data Center (June 2018)
item.description: Dates: June 22, 2018 12:30 to 14:00 Location: Davos, Switzerland Venue: POLAR 2018 Open Science Conference This hands-on session will cover (1) Open data archives, especially the Arctic Data Center; (2) What science metadata is and how it can be used; (3) How data and code can be documented and published in open data archives; (4) Web-based submission, and (5) Submission using R (pending sufficient time). Course overview The Arctic Data Center conducts training in data science and management, both of which are critical skills for stewardship of data, software, and other products of research that are preserved at the Arctic Data Center.

item.title: Tools for Data Science in Arctic Research (July 2017)
item.description: Dates: July 31 - Aug 1, 2017 Location: Santa Barbara, CA Venue: NCEAS, 735 State St., Suite 300, UC Santa Barbara The Arctic Data Center provides training in data science and data management, as these are critical skills for the stewardship of the data, software, and other research products that are preserved in the Arctic Data Center. A goal of the Arctic Data Center is to advance data archiving and promote reproducible science and data reuse.
